context: The Finnish verb 'menn√§' means 'to go'. It is an intransitive verb, meaning it doesn't take a direct object. It can also express how things are going for someone ('I'm doing quite well'). The word has many uses and conjugations, including expressing movement away from a point of reference, leading (of paths), or even taking time to complete something.  The form 'menemme' indicates 'we go'.
